content.webTitle: Crystal Palace v Leeds: match preview

fields.headline: Crystal Palace v Leeds: match preview
fields.bodyText: Leeds have a tough ask in taking on the experienced Roy Hodgson and Crystal Palace. Hodgson’s side give nothing away and will be well prepared to hold firm and launch counterattacks while the visitors, level on points with Palace, go through their death by a thousand passes routine. It has worked well for the equally experienced Marcelo Bielsa but last week’s defeat to Leicester was Leeds’ poorest showing so far. Avoiding a painful slump from an excellent comeback to the top flight would be ideal before the international break. Graham Searles Saturday 3pm BT Sport Box Office Venue Selhurst Park Last season n/a Odds H 2-1 A 6-4 D 5-2 Referee Chris Kavanagh This season G4 Y18 R0 4.5 cards/game CRYSTAL PALACE Subs from Henderson, Kelly, McCarthy, Meyer, Jach, Benteke, Tomkins, Eze, Cahill, Sakho, Mitchell Doubtful Cahill (shin), Tomkins (match fitness) Injured Ward (groin, unknown), Wickham (knock, unknown), Hennessey (thigh, unknown) Suspended Milivojevic (first of three) Discipline Y12 R1 Form WLLDWL Leading scorer Zaha 5 LEEDS Subs from Poveda, Casilla, Raphinha, Roberts, Shackleton, Struijk, Casey, Davis Doubtful Raphinha (ankle) Injured Rodrigo (coronavirus, 21 Nov), Phillips (shoulder, Dec), Llorente (groin, unknown), Forshaw (hip, unknown) Suspended None Discipline Y9 R0 Form WWDLWL Leading scorer Bamford 6
